snippet: Emotionally abusive comments are becoming more common online, and the consequences could include scaring away from the web those subject to attacks.
abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column laments that the Internet and social media seem to be losing the war against trolls and trolling, catchall term for online troublemakers who routinely engage in graphically provocative or even abusive speech; holds that primary motivation for trolling is to titillate other trolls, setting up the central difficulty in controlling bad behavior because shedding light on it may only encourage it.
lead_paragraph: Emotionally abusive comments are becoming more common online, and the consequences could include scaring away from the web those subject to attacks.

headline.main: Web Trolls Winning as Incivility Increases
headline.print_headline: Web Trolls Winning as Incivility Increases
